am_devices_mspi_gd25lb.h File Reference

GigaDevice Serial NOR SPI Flash driver. More...

Detailed Description

GigaDevice Serial NOR SPI Flash driver.

Go to the source code of this file.

Data Structures

struct  am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_config_t

extern

De-Initialization the mspi flash driver.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.

This function reverses the initialization.

Returns
32-bit status.

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_id()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_id ( void * pHandle)
extern

Reads the ID of the external flash .

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.

This function reads the device ID register of the external flash, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_init()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_init ( uint32_t ui32Module,
am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_config_t * psMSPISettings,
void ** ppHandle,
void ** ppMspiHandle )
extern

Initialize the mspi flash driver.

Parameters
ui32Module- module instance.
psMSPISettings- MSPI device structure describing the target spiflash.
ppHandle- returns the handle for the MSPI Device instance.
ppMspiHandle- returns the handle for the MSPI instance.

This function should be called before any other am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512 functions. It is used to set tell the other functions how to communicate with the external flash hardware.

Returns
32-bit status.

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_mass_erase()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_mass_erase ( void * pHandle)
extern

Erases the entire contents of the external flash.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.

This function uses the "Bulk Erase" instruction to erase the entire contents of the external flash.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
bool bWaitForCompletion )
extern

Reads the contents of the external flash into a buffer.

Parameters
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the flash
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external flash
bWaitForCompletion- Wait for transaction completion before exiting

This function reads the external flash at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data.If the bWaitForCompletion is true, then the function will poll for DMA completion indication flag before returning.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read_adv()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read_adv ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
uint32_t ui32PauseCondition,
uint32_t ui32StatusSetClr,
am_hal_mspi_callback_t pfnCallback,
void * pCallbackCtxt )
extern

Reads the contents of the external flash into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the flash
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external flash
ui32PauseCondition- Pause condition before transaction is executed
ui32StatusSetClr- Post-transaction CQ condition
pfnCallback- Post-transaction callback function
pCallbackCtxt- Post-transaction callback context

This function reads the external flash at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data. The Command Queue pre and post transaction conditions and a callback function and context are also provided.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read_hiprio()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_read_hiprio ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
bool bWaitForCompletion )
extern

High priority Reads the contents of the external flash into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the flash
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external flash
bWaitForCompletion- Wait for transaction completion before exiting

This function reads the external flash at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_reset()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_reset ( void * pHandle)
extern

Reset the external flash.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.

This function reset the external flash, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status.

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_sector_erase()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_sector_erase ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ui32SectorAddress )
extern

Erases the contents of a single sector of flash.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.
ui32SectorAddress- Address to erase in the external flash

This function erases a single sector of the external flash as specified by ui32EraseAddress. The entire sector where ui32EraseAddress will be erased.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_status()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_status ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pStatus )
extern

Reads the current status of the external flash.

Parameters
pHandle- Flash device handle.
pStatus- Flash device status.

This function reads the status register of the external flash, and returns the result as an 8-bit unsigned integer value. The processor will block during the data transfer process, but will return as soon as the status register had been read.

Returns
32-bit status..

◆ am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_write()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_gd25lb512_write ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8TxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32WriteAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
bool bWaitForCompletion )
extern

Programs the given range of flash addresses.

Parameters
ui32DeviceNumber- Device number of the external flash
pui8TxBuffer- Buffer to write the external flash data from
ui32WriteAddress- Address to write to in the external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to write to the external flash

This function uses the data in the provided pui8TxBuffer and copies it to the external flash at the address given by ui32WriteAddress. It will copy exactly ui32NumBytes of data from the original pui8TxBuffer pointer. The user is responsible for ensuring that they do not overflow the target flash memory or underflow the pui8TxBuffer array

Returns
32-bit status
